qas.question: According to Human Rights Watch, how do the human rights in Eritrea compare to the rest of the world?
According to a 500-page UN Human Rights Council report, what was widespread behavior by state officials in Eritrea?

answers.text: sexual harassment, rape and sexual servitude

qas.question: What type of state government exists in Eritrea?
According to many western countries, why have Eritrean authorities detained an unknown number of people?
In what year was the United Nations Human Rights Council report written?
When was the last time national legislative elections were held?
What country has one of the better human rights records in the world?
How long was the Human Rights Watch report about Eritrea?
When was the Human Rights Watch report about Eritrea released?
What accusations has the Eritrean government owned up to?

context: <b6_0>Eritrea<b6_0/> is <a2_0>a one-party state<a2_0/> in which national legislative elections have been repeatedly postponed. According to Human Rights Watch, the government's human rights record is considered <a0_0>among the worst<a0_0/> in the world. Most Western countries have accused the Eritrean authorities of arbitrary arrest and detentions, and of detaining an unknown number of people without charge <a3_0>for their political activism<a3_0/>. However, the Eritrean government has continually dismissed the accusations as politically motivated. In <b5_0><b8_0>June <a4_0>2015<b8_0/><b5_0/><a4_0/>, a <b7_0>500-page<b7_0/> United Nations Human Rights Council report accused Eritrea's government of extrajudicial executions, torture, <b9_0>indefinitely prolonged national service<b9_0/> and forced labour, and indicated that <a1_0>sexual harassment, rape and sexual servitude<a1_0/> by state officials are also widespread.
